item.description:
We will finish Hobbes' Leviathan next time. The last book "Of the Kingdome of Darknesse" remains. We also decided that after the next meeting we will return to Spinoza for 3 meetings to read his Tractatus Theologico-Politicus. It is probably interesting on its own right, however its connection to "Straussianism" makes it more so. Wittgenstein's Tractatus Logico Philosophicus (considered one of the most important philosophical works of the 20th century) got its name after this work of Spinoza.

See you next time.
item.name: Thomas Hobbes: Leviathan V
